Your friends can explore the park's various trails and enjoy the peaceful winter scenery.

Certainly! Here's a suggested itinerary for your 3-day trip to Nanjing in winter:

Day 1:
9:00 am - 12:00 pm: Dr. Sun Yat-sen's Mausoleum - Located at the foot of the Purple Mountain, the mausoleum is a must-visit attraction in Nanjing. In the winter, the scenery is less crowded and the cold weather makes for a brisk but invigorating climb up the stairs to the top, where you can enjoy a stunning view of the city.

12:00 pm - 1:30 pm: Lunch time

1:30 pm - 4:30 pm: Purple Mountain Observatory - As one of the oldest astronomical observatories in China, the Purple Mountain Observatory is a fascinating attraction to visit in the winter. The clear skies and crisp air make for ideal conditions to observe the stars and planets. You can take a guided tour of the observatory and learn about the history of astronomy in China.

Day 2:
9:00 am - 12:00 pm: Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum - The Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and the tomb of the Hongwu Emperor, the first emperor of the Ming dynasty. In the winter, the mausoleum is surrounded by snow-covered pine trees and the quiet atmosphere makes for a peaceful visit.

12:00 pm - 1:30 pm: Lunch time

1:30 pm - 4:30 pm: Nanjing City Wall - The Nanjing City Wall is one of the best-preserved city walls in China and provides a glimpse into the city's rich history. In the winter, the wall is less crowded and the cool weather makes for a comfortable walk along the top of the wall, where you can enjoy panoramic views of the city.

Day 3:
9:00 am - 12:00 pm: Xuanwu Lake - Xuanwu Lake is a scenic spot located in the heart of Nanjing. In the winter, the lake takes on a tranquil quality and the surrounding park is less crowded. You can take a leisurely stroll around the lake or rent a paddleboat to enjoy the winter scenery.

12:00 pm - 1:30 pm: Lunch time

1:30 pm - 4:30 pm: Confucius Temple - The Confucius Temple is a complex of buildings and gardens dedicated to the memory of Confucius, the great philosopher and educator. In the winter, the temple is less crowded and the peaceful atmosphere makes for a relaxing visit. You can admire the intricate architecture and take a stroll through the gardens.

Attractions like Zijin Mountain and West Lake are not located in Nanjing, so they are not included in this itinerary. Instead, I've suggested some attractions that are more relevant to your trip. I hope you find this itinerary helpful and enjoyable!
